question.body: Which of the following would be correct for the thoraco-lumbar region of the spinal cord?

multiple_choice.choice: it has well developed anterior horns
it has well developed ascending tracts
it has the least developed posterior horns

response.feedback: Incorrect. This has well developed lateral horns because they supply the sympathetic nervous system.
Correct. This region supplies the motor nerves for the skeletal muscles of the lower limbs.

Incorrect. At the lower end of the spinal cord there is less white matter relative to the gray matter because there are fewer tracts heading to and from brain compared to more superior parts of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. The gray commissure is present along the whole length of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. The posterior horns receive sensory input from posterior spinal root and would be as developed as other parts of the spinal cord, with sensory input from the lower limbs.

question.body: In which spinal cord structure visible from cross section would you expect to find synaptic transmission?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is white matter structure with ascending and descending tracts.
Correct. Any of the gray matter horns or gray commissure would be site of synaptic transmission.
Incorrect. This is white matter structure with ascending and descending tracts.
Incorrect. This is white matter structure connecting right and left columns.
Incorrect. This is the cerebrospinal fluid filled space in the middle of the gray commissure.
